Package sammish93.tbage.tools

Class EncounterController

java.lang.Object
sammish93.tbage.tools.EncounterController
public class EncounterController extends Object
A class intended to be used to control how the framework responds to certain player behaviours, interactions, and input.

  • Method Details

    • turn

      public static void turn(GameEngine gameEngine, Encounter encounter, int turnNumber) throws InventoryFullException, InvalidValueException, InterruptedException
      A method designed to handle how a CombatEncounter behaves, and to simulate turn-based combat.
      Parameters:
      gameEngine - Required to communicate with other dependencies such as the game interface.
      encounter - Required to determine exactly which Encounter object is to be interacted with.
      turnNumber - Required to display the current turn number of the turn-based combat. Has no bearing on anything else.
      Throws:
      InventoryFullException - Thrown in the event that an enemy drops an item, but the player cannot receive the item because their inventory is full.
      InvalidValueException - Thrown in the event of an invalid value being provided. See specific methods for more information on what constitutes a valid value.
      InterruptedException
      See Also:
      • CombatEncounter

    • useItem

      public static void useItem(GameEngine gameEngine) throws InventoryFullException, InvalidValueException, InterruptedException
      A method intended to handle behaviour when a player chooses to use an item. Further behaviour can be given via a generic Useable interface being provided.
      Parameters:
      gameEngine - Required to communicate with other dependencies such as the game interface.
      Throws:
      InventoryFullException - Thrown in the event that an item removed from a player's inventory could result in an inventory being full.
      InvalidValueException - Thrown in the event of an invalid value being provided. See specific methods for more information on what constitutes a valid value.
      InterruptedException
      See Also:
      • Item.setOnUseBehaviour(Useable)

    • chooseNpc

      public static NonPlayableCharacter chooseNpc(GameEngine gameEngine, Encounter encounter) throws InterruptedException
      A method intended to be used to choose a specific NonPlayableCharacter object. This can also be used by a generic Useable interface provided to, for example, an Item object.
      Parameters:
      gameEngine - Required to communicate with other dependencies such as the game interface.
      encounter - Required to determine exactly which Encounter object is to be interacted with.
      Returns:
      Returns a NonPlayableCharacter object after a player has selected one via input prompts in the game interface.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException
      See Also:
      • Item.setOnUseBehaviour(Useable)
      • NonPlayableCharacter

    • chooseProp

      public static Prop chooseProp(GameEngine gameEngine, Encounter encounter) throws InterruptedException
      A method intended to be used to choose a specific Prop object.
      Parameters:
      gameEngine - Required to communicate with other dependencies such as the game interface.
      encounter - Required to determine exactly which Encounter object is to be interacted with.
      Returns:

      Throws:

      See Also:
      • Prop

    • chooseItem

      public static Item chooseItem(GameEngine gameEngine, Ally ally) throws InterruptedException
      A method intended to be used to choose a specific Item object when interacting (trading) with an Ally. Once an item is chosen, its cost is deducted from the player's currency amount, and it is added to a player's inventory. In the case of the inventory being full, or the player not having enough gold, a message is shown in the game interface.
      Parameters:
      gameEngine - Required to communicate with other dependencies such as the game interface.
      ally - Required to determine exactly which Ally object is to be interacted with.
      Returns:
      Returns an Item object after a player has selected one via input prompts in the game interface.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • getEncounterDrops

      public static void getEncounterDrops(GameEngine gameEngine, Encounter encounter) throws InvalidValueException, InterruptedException
      A class intended to calculate which items are dropped from a specific encounter. The items in question depend on the Encounter in question, and the items (together with drop percentage) that each Enemy object has. Once the items have been dropped on the encounter being defeated then they will be added to a player's inventory.
      Parameters:
      gameEngine - Required to communicate with other dependencies such as the game interface.
      encounter - Required to determine exactly which Encounter object is to be interacted with.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown in the event of an invalid value being provided. See specific methods for more information on what constitutes a valid value.
      InterruptedException

    • getFeatRewards

      public static void getFeatRewards(GameEngine gameEngine, Encounter encounter) throws InterruptedException
      Throws:
      InterruptedException
